episodeTitle: Round 1! One Lap of the Donut Race!
description: The Davy Back Fight begins with the first round, the Donut Race. Teams from the Straw Hats and Foxy Pirates build makeshift boats from barrels and race around Long Ring Long Land in a competition filled with obstacles, sabotage, and intense competition.

events.title: Itomimizu and Chuchun Debut
events.description: Itomimizu, the Foxy Pirates' announcer, appears riding his giant bird Chuchun to commentate the Davy Back Fight events. He explains the rules and provides bird's-eye coverage of the competition.
events.significance: Introduces the official announcer for the Davy Back Fight games, adding structure and formality to the pirate competition.

events.title: Capote and Monda Debut
events.description: Capote, a billfish fish-man who practices Fish-Man Karate, and Monda, a Star Shark, are introduced as members of the Foxy Pirates' racing team for the Donut Race.
events.significance: Introduces key competitors for the Donut Race who will use their aquatic abilities to gain an advantage in the water-based competition.

events.title: Donut Race Rules Explained
events.description: Itomimizu explains the Donut Race rules: teams of three must build boats from barrels and race around the island. Teams can use any means including weapons and sabotage to win, and crew members on shore can assist.
events.significance: Establishes the rules and high-stakes nature of the Davy Back Fight competition, showing that nearly anything goes in pursuit of victory.

quotes.text: Both teams are allowed to use weapons, and can do anything, including pushing the other boat backwards, do damage to the other boat and even kill all the members of the opposing team.
quotes.speaker: Itomimizu
quotes.context: Explaining the brutal rules of the Donut Race

events.title: Teams Build Their Boats
events.description: The Straw Hats (Nami, Usopp, Robin in manga; entire crew in anime) and Foxy Pirates (Porche, Capote, Monda) construct their racing vessels from barrels. The Straw Hats create the 'Barrel Tiger' while the Foxy Pirates build the 'Cutie Wagon'.
events.significance: Demonstrates the resourcefulness and creativity of both crews as they prepare for the race using limited materials.

events.title: The Donut Race Begins
events.description: The first round of the Davy Back Fight commences as both teams launch their boats and begin racing around Long Ring Long Land. The Foxy Pirates immediately take an early lead.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Davy Back Fight competition between the Straw Hats and Foxy Pirates with crew members at stake.

events.title: Capote Uses Kaimen Wari
events.description: Capote demonstrates his Fish-Man Karate technique 'Kaimen Wari' (Ocean Surface Splitter), using a karate chop to generate shock waves that slice through the ocean surface to attack opponents.
events.significance: First display of Fish-Man Karate in the Davy Back Fight, showcasing the combat techniques allowed in the race.

quotes.speaker: Capote
quotes.context: Using his Fish-Man Karate technique during the race

events.title: Robin Uses Ocho Fleur: Flip
events.description: Nico Robin uses her Hana Hana no Mi ability to sprout eight arms - six to hold Capote and two from his lower back - to flip him upside down so he falls on his head, countering his Fish-Man Karate attack.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's strategic use of her Devil Fruit powers in combat situations and her contribution to the racing team.

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Using her technique to counter Capote's attack

events.title: Foxy Pirates Attack from Shore
events.description: Following the Donut Race rules that allow outside assistance, Foxy Pirates crew members attack the Straw Hats' boat from the shoreline. The remaining Straw Hats on shore counter these attacks to protect their racing team.
events.significance: Demonstrates the 'anything goes' nature of the Davy Back Fight and the importance of the entire crew working together.

events.title: Usopp Uses Impact Dial
events.description: Usopp employs an Impact Dial from Skypiea to give the Barrel Tiger a massive speed boost, launching them forward and allowing them to catch up to and overtake the Cutie Wagon in the race.
events.significance: Shows the Straw Hats utilizing equipment from previous adventures and demonstrates Usopp's tactical thinking in using stored technology.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Releasing the Impact Dial to boost their boat's speed

events.title: Capote and Monda's Two-Fish Engine
events.description: Capote places his legs in Monda's mouth, creating a 'Two-Fish Engine' that dramatically increases their swimming speed and allows the Cutie Wagon to navigate through difficult waters like coral reefs and whirlpools.
events.significance: Showcases the unique teamwork and combination abilities possible between a fish-man and sea creature, highlighting the Foxy Pirates' experience in the Davy Back Fight.

events.title: Impact Dial Used to Clear Whirlpool
events.description: As the Barrel Tiger approaches a giant whirlpool, Nami urges Usopp to use the Impact Dial again. Usopp releases it, launching their boat into the air to fly over the dangerous whirlpool obstacle.
events.significance: Demonstrates creative problem-solving and the versatility of Skypiea technology in overcoming natural obstacles.

quotes.text: Use the Impact Dial again! It's the only way to win!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Encouraging Usopp to use their trump card to overcome the whirlpool

quotes.text: Both teams are allowed to use weapons, and can do anything!
quotes.speaker: Itomimizu
Nico Robin
quotes.context: Using her Devil Fruit power against Capote

quotes.text: Use the Impact Dial again! It's the only way to win!
quotes.speaker: Nami

themes.description: The Davy Back Fight showcases a pirate competition with strict rules yet allows almost anything to win. The episode explores the tension between following rules and doing whatever it takes to protect your crew.
themes.symbolism: The Donut Race represents the circular nature of pirate rivalry - going around in circles but always coming back to protect your nakama.

themes.description: Success in the Donut Race requires both the racing team and shore support to work together. The Straw Hats must combine Nami's navigation, Usopp's tools, and Robin's combat abilities to compete.
themes.symbolism: The makeshift barrel boats symbolize how crews must work with limited resources and rely on each member's unique strengths.

themes.description: Both crews must build boats from minimal materials and use whatever advantages they have - the Straw Hats use Skypiea technology while the Foxy Pirates leverage their fish-man and sea creature members.

characterSpotlights.role: Navigator and strategist for the Barrel Tiger
characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her navigation skills and tactical thinking, using her knowledge of ocean currents to compete against the physically superior Foxy Pirates team.
keyActions: Navigates the Barrel Tiger using her weather and current knowledge
Coordinates strategy with Usopp and Robin
Urges Usopp to use the Impact Dial at critical moments
quotes: Use the Impact Dial again! It's the only way to win!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's contribution from Skypiea pays off as his Impact Dial becomes crucial to the race strategy, though he also provides comedic moments through arguments with his teammates.
keyActions: Uses Impact Dial to boost the boat's speed
Argues with Nami and Robin about racing strategy
Provides the technological edge needed to compete

characterSpotlights.role: Combat specialist for the racing team
characterSpotlights.development: Robin shows her combat versatility by using her Hana Hana no Mi powers defensively during the race to counter enemy attacks.
keyActions: Uses Ocho Fleur: Flip to counter Capote's Fish-Man Karate
Helps protect the boat from enemy interference
Works cooperatively with Nami and Usopp

characterSpotlights.role: Primary competitor for the Foxy Pirates
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a skilled fish-man who uses Fish-Man Karate and combines with Monda to create a powerful racing advantage.
keyActions: Demonstrates Fish-Man Karate with Kaimen Wari
Creates the Two-Fish Engine with Monda
Attacks the Straw Hats' boat during the race

characterSpotlights.development: Establishes himself as a fair and enthusiastic commentator who adds structure to the Davy Back Fight competition.
keyActions: Maintains the formal structure of the competition
quotes: Both teams are allowed to use weapons, and can do anything!

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, only Nami, Usopp, and Robin participate in the Donut Race for the Straw Hats. In the anime, the entire crew joins the race with multiple boats, though the main focus remains on the Barrel Tiger crew.
The anime adds additional Foxy Pirates crew members and racing teams that weren't present in the manga version of the Donut Race.

trivia.fact: The four female racers in the anime were voiced by members of the J-pop band BOYSTYLE, who also performed the opening theme 'Kokoro no Chizu'.
This episode adapts Chapter 306 (pages 16-19) and Chapter 307 (pages 2-19) of the manga.
Kokoro no Chizu was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen format.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Impact Dial used by Usopp was obtained during the Skypiea arc, demonstrating how tools from previous adventures continue to be relevant.
